TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit WebSettings extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Manages settings state for a WebView.

remarks.para: Manages settings state for a WebView. When a WebView is first created, it obtains a set of default settings. These default settings will be returned from any getter call. A WebSettings object obtained from WebView.getSettings() is tied to the life of the WebView. If a WebView has been destroyed, any method call on WebSettings will throw an IllegalStateException.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int javaReference, valuetype Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer) cil managed

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool AllowContentAccess { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether this WebView supports content URL access.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets whether this WebView supports content URL access.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Enables or disables content URL access within WebView. Content URL access allows WebView to load content from a content provider installed in the system. The default is enabled.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool AllowFileAccess { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether this WebView supports file access.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets whether this WebView supports file access.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Enables or disables file access within WebView. File access is enabled by default. Note that this enables or disables file system access only. Assets and resources are still accessible using file:///android_asset and file:///android_res.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract bool AllowFileAccessFromFileURLs { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether JavaScript running in the context of a file scheme URL can access content from other file scheme URLs.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets whether JavaScript running in the context of a file scheme URL can access content from other file scheme URLs.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets whether JavaScript running in the context of a file scheme URL should be allowed to access content from other file scheme URLs. To enable the most restrictive, and therefore secure policy, this setting should be disabled. Note that the value of this setting is ignored if the value of is true. Note too, that this setting affects only JavaScript access to file scheme resources. Other access to such resources, for example, from image HTML elements, is unaffected.
The default value is true for API level and below, and false for API level and above.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract bool AllowUniversalAccessFromFileURLs { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether JavaScript running in the context of a file scheme URL can access content from any origin.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets whether JavaScript running in the context of a file scheme URL can access content from any origin. This includes access to content from other file scheme URLs.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets whether JavaScript running in the context of a file scheme URL should be allowed to access content from any origin. This includes access to content from other file scheme URLs. See . To enable the most restrictive, and therefore secure policy, this setting should be disabled. Note that this setting affects only JavaScript access to file scheme resources. Other access to such resources, for example, from image HTML elements, is unaffected.
The default value is true for API level and below, and false for API level and above.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool BlockNetworkImage { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether the WebView does not load image resources from the network.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets whether the WebView does not load image resources from the network.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets whether the WebView should not load image resources from the network (resources accessed via http and https URI schemes). Note that this method has no effect unless returns true. Also note that disabling all network loads using will also prevent network images from loading, even if this flag is set to false. When the value of this setting is changed from true to false, network images resources referenced by content currently displayed by the WebView are fetched automatically. The default is false.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool BlockNetworkLoads { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether the WebView does not load any resources from the network.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets whether the WebView does not load any resources from the network.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets whether the WebView should not load resources from the network. Use to only avoid loading image resources. Note that if the value of this setting is changed from true to false, network resources referenced by content currently displayed by the WebView are not fetched until is called. If the application does not have the permission, attempts to set a value of false will cause a to be thrown. The default value is false if the application has the permission, otherwise it is true.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool BuiltInZoomControls { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether the zoom mechanisms built into WebView are being used.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets whether the zoom mechanisms built into WebView are being used.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets whether the WebView should use its built-in zoom mechanisms. The built-in zoom mechanisms comprise on-screen zoom controls, which are displayed over the WebView's content, and the use of a pinch gesture to control zooming. Whether or not these on-screen controls are displayed can be set with . The default is false.
The built-in mechanisms are the only currently supported zoom mechanisms, so it is recommended that this setting is always enabled.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Webkit.CacheModes CacheMode { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets the current setting for overriding the cache mode.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the current setting for overriding the cache mode.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Overrides the way the cache is used. The way the cache is used is based on the navigation type. For a normal page load, the cache is checked and content is re-validated as needed. When navigating back, content is not revalidated, instead the content is just retrieved from the cache. This method allows the client to override this behavior by specifying one of , , or . The default value is .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string CursiveFontFamily { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets the cursive font family name.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the cursive font family name.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the cursive font family name. The default is "cursive".

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool DatabaseEnabled { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether the database storage API is enabled.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets whether the database storage API is enabled.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets whether the database storage API is enabled. The default value is false. See also for how to correctly set up the database storage API.
This setting is global in effect, across all WebView instances in a process. Note you should only modify this setting prior to making any WebView page load within a given process, as the WebView implementation may ignore changes to this setting after that point.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string DatabasePath { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets the path to where database storage API databases are saved.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the path to where database storage API databases are saved.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the path to where database storage API databases should be saved. In order for the database storage API to function correctly, this method must be called with a path to which the application can write. This method should only be called once: repeated calls are ignored.

Docs.summary: Gets the default fixed font size.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the default fixed font size.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the default fixed font size. The default is 16.

remarks.para:

remarks.para:

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the default zoom density of the page. This should be called from the UI thread.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the default zoom density of the page. This must be called from the UI thread. The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool DisplayZoomControls { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether the WebView displays on-screen zoom controls when using the built-in zoom mechanisms.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets whether the WebView should display on-screen zoom controls when using the built-in zoom mechanisms. See . The default is true.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool JavaScriptCanOpenWindowsAutomatically { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether JavaScript can open windows automatically.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets whether JavaScript can open windows automatically.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Tells JavaScript to open windows automatically. This applies to the JavaScript function window.open(). The default is false.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool JavaScriptEnabled { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether JavaScript is enabled.

remarks.para:

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool LightTouchEnabled { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether light touches are enabled.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets whether light touches are enabled.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool LoadsImagesAutomatically { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether the WebView loads image resources.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets whether the WebView loads image resources. This includes images embedded using the data URI scheme.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets whether the WebView should load image resources. Note that this method controls loading of all images, including those embedded using the data URI scheme. Use to control loading only of images specified using network URI schemes. Note that if the value of this setting is changed from false to true, all images resources referenced by content currently displayed by the WebView are loaded automatically. The default is true.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool LoadWithOverviewMode { get; set; }

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets whether the WebView loads pages in overview mode. The default is false.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetAppCacheEnabled(bool flag) cil managed

Docs.param: true if the WebView should enable Application Caches
Docs.summary: Sets whether the Application Caches API should be enabled.

remarks.para: Sets whether the Application Caches API should be enabled. The default is false. Note that in order for the Application Caches API to be enabled, a valid database path must also be supplied to .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetAppCacheMaxSize(int64 appCacheMaxSize) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the maximum size for the Application Cache content.

remarks.para: Sets the maximum size for the Application Cache content. The passed size will be rounded to the nearest value that the database can support, so this should be viewed as a guide, not a hard limit. Setting the size to a value less than current database size does not cause the database to be trimmed. The default size is . It is recommended to leave the maximum size set to the default value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetAppCachePath(string appCachePath) cil managed

Docs.param: a String path to the directory containing Application Caches files.
Docs.summary: Sets the path to the Application Caches files.

remarks.para: Sets the path to the Application Caches files. In order for the Application Caches API to be enabled, this method must be called with a path to which the application can write. This method should only be called once: repeated calls are ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetEnableSmoothTransition(bool enable) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets whether the WebView will enable smooth transition while panning or zooming or while the window hosting the WebView does not have focus.

remarks.para: Sets whether the WebView will enable smooth transition while panning or zooming or while the window hosting the WebView does not have focus. If it is true, WebView will choose a solution to maximize the performance. e.g. the WebView's content may not be updated during the transition. If it is false, WebView will keep its fidelity. The default value is false.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetGeolocationDatabasePath(string databasePath) cil managed

Docs.param: a path to the directory where databases should be saved.
Docs.summary: Sets the path where the Geolocation databases should be saved.

remarks.para: Sets the path where the Geolocation databases should be saved. In order for Geolocation permissions and cached positions to be persisted, this method must be called with a path to which the application can write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetGeolocationEnabled(bool flag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets whether Geolocation is enabled.

remarks.para: Sets whether Geolocation is enabled. The default is true.
As an option, it is possible to store previous locations and web origin permissions in a database. See .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetLayoutAlgorithm(class Android.Webkit.WebSettings/LayoutAlgorithm l) cil managed

Docs.param: the layout algorithm to use, as a value
Docs.summary: Sets the underlying layout algorithm.

remarks.para: Sets the underlying layout algorithm. This will cause a relayout of the WebView. The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetNeedInitialFocus(bool flag) cil managed

Docs.param: whether the WebView needs to set a node
Docs.summary: Tells the WebView whether it needs to set a node to have focus when is called.

remarks.para: Tells the WebView whether it needs to set a node to have focus when is called. The default value is true.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetPluginState(class Android.Webkit.WebSettings/PluginState state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Tells the WebView to enable, disable, or have plugins on demand.

remarks.para: Tells the WebView to enable, disable, or have plugins on demand. On demand mode means that if a plugin exists that can handle the embedded content, a placeholder icon will be shown instead of the plugin. When the placeholder is clicked, the plugin will be enabled. The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetRenderPriority(class Android.Webkit.WebSettings/RenderPriority priority) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the priority of the Render thread.

remarks.para: Sets the priority of the Render thread. Unlike the other settings, this one only needs to be called once per process. The default value is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetSupportMultipleWindows(bool support) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets whether the WebView whether supports multiple windows.

remarks.para: Sets whether the WebView whether supports multiple windows. If set to true, must be implemented by the host application. The default is false.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetSupportZoom(bool support) cil managed

Docs.param: whether the WebView should support zoom
Docs.summary: Sets whether the WebView should support zooming using its on-screen zoom controls and gestures.

remarks.para: Sets whether the WebView should support zooming using its on-screen zoom controls and gestures. The particular zoom mechanisms that should be used can be set with . This setting does not affect zooming performed using the and methods. The default is true.

Docs.param: the text size as a value
Docs.summary: Sets the text size of the page.

remarks.para: Sets the text size of the page. The default is .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Gets the WebView's user-agent string.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the WebView's user-agent string.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the WebView's user-agent string. If the string is null or empty, the system default value will be used.

Docs.summary: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool UseWideViewPort { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets whether the WebView supports the "viewport" HTML meta tag or will use a wide viewport.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets whether the WebView supports the "viewport" HTML meta tag or will use a wide viewport.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets whether the WebView should enable support for the "viewport" HTML meta tag or should use a wide viewport. When the value of the setting is false, the layout width is always set to the width of the WebView control in device-independent (CSS) pixels. When the value is true and the page contains the viewport meta tag, the value of the width specified in the tag is used. If the page does not contain the tag or does not provide a width, then a wide viewport will be used.
